item.title: MSPs to vote on Scottish vaccine passport scheme
item.description: The move will mean only fully vaccinated people will be allowed into nightclubs and many large events.

item.title: Call for Highland holiday lets to need planning permission
item.description: A Highland councillor says in some areas people struggle to find homes due to high numbers of short-term lets.

item.title: Scotland's papers: Covid spread slows and virus court 'con'
item.description: Claims that fake Covid alerts are being used to dodge court appearances and a slowdown in case numbers make the front pages.

item.title: How green is Scotland's space industry?
item.description: Scotland's thriving space sector is trying to have a reduced impact on the planet.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Surge in cases 'may be slowing down'
item.description: The first minister says the country still has a "very high level of infection" - but there are signs of it slowing down.

item.title: Scotland's hottest September day in 115 years
item.description: A temperature of 28.6C has been recorded in the Scottish Borders - the highest since a record in Moray in 1906.

item.title: SNP vote against new health and social care tax
item.description: The proposals would raise about £1.1bn a year for the Scottish health service, according to the UK government.

item.title: Cyclist dies after crash with car at Stirling roundabout
item.description: The man was pronounced dead at the scene on the A84 at Craigforth near Stirling.

item.title: Killer whale found dead on Orkney beach 'got caught in rope'
item.description: The orca found dead on a beach in Orkney is thought to have been one of a pod of 27 spotted regularly in the area.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Health boards warn of 'significant' pressure on services
item.description: Two boards pause non-emergency surgery amid "unprecedented demand" caused by rising cases and staff shortages.

item.title: Edinburgh sex attacker who raped four women 'checked pulse of victim'
item.description: Dillon Anderson raped four young women in a series of attacks, the first when he was 14.

item.title: Why is public service reform slow?
item.description: Ten years ago the Christie Report set out a blueprint for Scottish public service reform. Why has it not happened?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: 'I'm double-vaccinated but can't show the proof'
item.description: A woman who got one jab in England and one in Scotland says her vaccine certificate only confirms a single dose.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Opposition increasing towards vaccine passports
item.description: Resistance is building from different sectors to proposals for vaccine certification to be shown in selected settings.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What do we know about the vaccine passport?
item.description: A new vaccine passport scheme is planned for Scotland, but it is still unclear where it will be needed.

item.title: Why vaccinating all teens is a difficult decision
item.description: Concerns over a very rare heart side-effect are giving vaccine experts pause for thought.

item.title: Covid: How will Scotland's vaccine certificate change?
item.description: Scotland is launching a QR code system in line with similar "passports" rolled out across Europe.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Is the drive to get young people jabbed working?
item.description: Covid cases are rising sharply in young adults despite all over 16s being eligible for vaccination.

item.title: Covid jab response low for some immunosuppressed people
item.description: Some high risk patients had few or no infection-fighting antibodies in their blood, a vaccine study found.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: What does tax rise mean for Scotland?
item.description: Scotland and England face challenges in funding social care but the responses are increasingly divergent.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Can in-person GP appointments ever fully return?
item.description: Community doctors say demand is so high they cannot see a complete return to business as usual.

item.title: Climate change: Shetland's power struggle between oil and wind
item.description: The row over plans for a new oil field at Cambo has placed Shetland in the heart of the debate over energy production.

item.title: 'I can't get a driving test until next year'
item.description: A backlog due to the pandemic means learner drivers like Katie McKerral face long waits to sit their test.

item.title: Where could Scotland site a new national park?
item.description: An SNP-Green deal has cleared the way for the creation of the first new national park in nearly 20 years.

item.title: 'I've raised £100,000 after 24 years of coffee mornings'
item.description: Eleanor Moffat has spent more than 20 years organising charity events after her sister was diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: It was a dark time - now I want to revive granny's legacy
item.description: Barrie Henderson was devastated when his family restaurant closed, but now plans to bring back the family name.

item.title: 'I've eaten the same breakfast for the last 22 years'
item.description: A veteran hotel inspector reveals the highs and lows of working undercover in Scotland.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon outlines plans for National Care Service
item.description: The first minister has outlined her government's plans for the year ahead.

item.title: Great-gran raises £100,000 for charity over 24 years
item.description: Eleanor Moffat has reached her fundraising target after countless coffee mornings and other events in Coldstream and beyond.

item.title: Anas Sarwar: Vaccine passports may 'entrench vaccine hesitancy'
item.description: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar fears vaccine passports may deter people from getting the coronavirus jab.

item.title: Glasgow Pride Mardi Gla march returns
item.description: Pride celebrations have returned to Glasgow following its cancellation last year due to Covid.

item.title: Have you ever heard of alpaca therapy?
item.description: At a farm in Fife, a herd of the South American animals are being used to help people with varying disabilities and mental health issues.

item.title: Austria 0-1 Scotland: 'Mood shifts with World Cup destiny in Steve Clarke's side's hands'
item.description: Winning in Austria has not only put Scotland in control of their World Cup hopes, it has altered perceptions too, writes Tom English.

item.title: Glasgow City 1-2 Servette Women (agg: 2-3): Scottish champions out of Women's Champions League
item.description: Glasgow City's hopes of playing among Europe's elite this season are over after Swiss champions Servette came from behind to clinch their Women's Champions League second round tie.

item.title: Austria 0-1 Scotland: Steve Clarke says he 'believes in group' after priceless win
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke made an impassioned defence of his players after a crucial World Cup qualification win in Austria, saying "some people don't believe in this group but I do".

item.title: Ryder Cup: Scottish pair Robert MacIntyre & Calum Hill eyeing big finish in selection race
item.description: Ryder Cup selection reaches a dramatic conclusion this weekend and Scotland's Robert MacIntyre and Calum Hill are targeting the biggest win of their careers to gatecrash the European team.

item.title: US Open 2021: Britain's Joe Salisbury & Jamie Murray both reach doubles semi-finals
item.description: Britain's Jamie Murray and Joe Salisbury both go through to the men's doubles semi-finals at the US Open.
